content.question: The x axis ranges from 0 to 60 in increments of 10. The y axis ranges from 1 to 10 to the fourth power. Tick marks are shown for each power of 10, with 9 tick marks between each power of ten that get closer and closer together while moving up. The 6 plotted points have the following approximate coordinates: (10 comma 5) (20 comma 10) (30 comma 20) (40 comma 40) (50 comma 80) (60 comma 160) ​​The number of thousands of people that have visited a new website is recorded every <math alttext="10"><semantics><mn>10</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> days for <math alttext="60"><semantics><mn>60</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> days. These data are used to produce a semi-log plot as shown. The function <math alttext="N"><semantics><mi>N</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> gives the number of thousands of people that have visited the website for day <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following could define <math alttext="N open parentheses t close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>N</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="2.5 times 2 to the power of open parentheses t divided by 10 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mn>2.5</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="3 plus 2 to the power of open parentheses t divided by 10 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="2.5 times 2 to the power of open parentheses t divided by 10 close parentheses end exponent"><semantics><mrow><mn>2.5</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
